loan_process.overview: Getting an education loan through our platform is simple, fast, and completely digital. Here's how it works:

steps.title: Create Your Account
steps.description: Sign up with your email and basic details. Takes just 2 minutes.

steps.title: Complete Your Profile
steps.description: Fill in your academic background, admission details, and financial information. Our smart forms make this easy.

steps.title: Upload Documents
steps.description: Upload required documents like mark sheets, admission letter, KYC documents, and financial proofs.
steps.tip: Keep all documents ready as PDFs or JPGs before starting

steps.title: AI Analysis & Matching
steps.description: Our AI instantly analyzes your profile and matches you with the best NBFCs for your situation.
steps.what_happens: We evaluate 50+ factors including academic performance, university ranking, course type, financial background, and co-borrower strength

steps.title: Review Matches & Apply
steps.description: Review your NBFC matches with loan details and interest rates. Submit to your preferred lenders.
steps.tip: You can apply to multiple NBFCs to maximize approval chances

steps.title: NBFC Review
steps.description: NBFCs review your application, may request additional documents or schedule interviews.
steps.what_to_expect: You'll get notifications for any updates or document requests

steps.title: Loan Approval & Disbursement
steps.description: Once approved, complete final formalities and get your loan disbursed directly to your university.

loan_process.total_timeline: Most students complete the application in under 1 hour and receive loan approval within 7-14 days

documents_required.why_we_need_documents: Documents help us verify your identity, assess your eligibility, and match you with the right lenders. Complete documentation increases approval chances by 60%.

academic_documents.why_needed: Academic documents prove your educational background and help NBFCs assess your credibility. Strong academic performance can get you better interest rates.
tips: Include provisional certificates if final ones are pending

documents: Admission Letter / Offer Letter from University
admission_documents.why_needed: Admission documents confirm you've been accepted to a university and help determine the exact loan amount required. NBFCs only fund students with valid admissions.
admission_documents.format: PDF - must be official documents from university
tips: Include detailed fee breakdown showing tuition, living costs, etc.
If conditional offer, show proof of meeting conditions

kyc_documents.why_needed: KYC documents are legally required for loan applications. They verify your identity and comply with RBI regulations. Without complete KYC, your application cannot be processed.
tips: Ensure Aadhaar and PAN are linked
Address on documents should match current residence
Passport must be valid for at least 2 years

financial_documents.why_needed: Financial documents help NBFCs assess your family's repayment capacity. Strong financial background can help you get loans without collateral or at better interest rates.
financial_documents.format: Bank statements: PDF from bank portal. Other docs: PDF or scanned
tips: Show consistent income and healthy bank balance
Property docs significantly improve approval chances
Don't hide loans - declare existing liabilities honestly

coborrower_documents.why_needed: Most education loans require a co-borrower (usually parents/guardians) who guarantees loan repayment. Co-borrower's financial strength is crucial for approval.
who_can_be_coborrower: Blood relatives with strong financial background
tips: Better co-borrower profile = better loan terms
Some NBFCs allow 2 co-borrowers for large loans

common_questions.q: What if I don't have all documents?
common_questions.a: Start your application with available documents. Our system will guide you on missing items. You can upload documents progressively.

common_questions.q: Do I need property for collateral?
common_questions.a: Not always! Loans up to ₹7.5 lakhs are often collateral-free. For higher amounts, requirements vary by NBFC. Our AI will match you with suitable lenders based on your collateral availability.

common_questions.q: Can I apply if my parents are self-employed?
common_questions.a: Yes! Self-employed parents need to provide ITR, business proof, and bank statements. Many NBFCs work with self-employed co-borrowers.

basic_requirements: Admission to a recognized foreign university

positive_factors: Strong academic record (above 60% in previous degrees)
Co-borrower with stable income (₹5+ lakhs annual)
negative_factors: Poor academic record (multiple backlogs, low grades)

eligibility.loan_amount_range: ₹10 lakhs to ₹1 crore depending on course fees, university, and your financial profile

loan_terms.interest_rates: 9.5% to 15% per annum depending on NBFC, loan amount, and your profile. Better profiles get lower rates.
loan_terms.repayment_period: 7 to 15 years typically. Longer tenure available for higher loan amounts.
loan_terms.moratorium_period: Course duration + 6 months to 1 year. You start repaying only after completing your course and finding a job.
loan_terms.processing_fees: 1% to 3% of loan amount (varies by NBFC)
loan_terms.collateral: Required for loans above ₹7.5 lakhs in most cases. Can be property, FDs, LIC policies, etc.

nbfc_information.what_is_nbfc: NBFC (Non-Banking Financial Company) is a company licensed by RBI to provide banking services without holding a banking license. NBFCs specialize in education loans and often have better approval rates than traditional banks.
nbfc_information.our_partners: We partner with 10+ leading NBFCs including specialized education loan providers. Each has different eligibility criteria, interest rates, and approval processes.
nbfc_information.why_multiple_nbfcs: Different NBFCs prefer different student profiles. Some focus on top universities, others on mid-tier. Some prefer collateral loans, others offer collateral-free. Our AI finds the best matches for YOUR specific situation.
nbfc_information.how_matching_works_general: We analyze your academic profile, university ranking, financial background, and co-borrower strength. Then we match you with NBFCs that have approved similar profiles historically. We DON'T reveal the exact algorithm to protect our intellectual property.
nbfc_information.can_apply_to_multiple: Yes! You can apply to 2-3 matched NBFCs simultaneously to maximize approval chances. This doesn't affect your credit score.

common_faqs.q: How long does the entire process take?
common_faqs.a: Application completion: 30-60 minutes. NBFC review: 3-10 business days. Approval to disbursement: 2-5 days. Total: 1-3 weeks typically.

common_faqs.q: Can I track my application status?
common_faqs.a: Yes! Real-time tracking available in your dashboard. You'll also receive email/SMS notifications for every status update.

common_faqs.q: What if I get rejected by one NBFC?
common_faqs.a: You can apply to other matched NBFCs. Rejection by one doesn't affect your chances with others. Our consultants can also help improve your application.

common_faqs.q: Do you charge students any fees?
common_faqs.a: Our platform is FREE for students. You only pay processing fees to the NBFC if your loan is approved (1-3% of loan amount).

common_faqs.q: Can I get a loan without collateral?
common_faqs.a: Yes, for loans up to ₹7.5 lakhs. Above that, collateral requirements vary by NBFC. Some may approve without collateral if you have strong academic and financial profile.

common_faqs.q: What happens if I don't get a visa?
common_faqs.a: Most NBFCs allow loan cancellation if visa is rejected. Check specific NBFC policies during application.
After course completion + 6-12 months moratorium (grace period). You don't pay during your studies.

tips_for_success: Start your application early - at least 2-3 months before visa application
Ensure all documents are complete and clear before uploading
Maintain good communication with your assigned consultant
Apply to 2-3 matched NBFCs to maximize approval chances
Be honest in your application - false information leads to rejection
Keep your contact details updated for quick communication
Respond promptly to document requests from NBFCs
